sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The sermon that the reuerende father in Christ, Hugh Latimer, Byshop of Worcester, made to the clergie, in the co[n]uocatio[n], before the Parlyament began, the 9. day of June, the 28. yere of the reigne of Our Souerayne Lorde Kyng Henry the VIII nowe translated out of Latyne into Englyshe ; to the inte[n]t, that thing is well said to a fewe, may be vnderstande of many, and do good to al the[m] that desyre to be better. Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.
[71] p.
By Thomas Berthelet ..., Imprinted at London : 1537, the 23 of Nouember.
Imprint taken from colophon. "Cum priuilegio."--Colophon. Signatures: A-D⁸ E⁴. Title in ornamental border. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
The sermon that the reuerende father in Christ, Hugh Latimer, Byshop of Worcester, made to the clergie, in the co[n]uocatio[n], before the Parlyament began, the 9. day of June, the 28. yere of the reigne of Our Souerayne Lorde Kyng Henry the VIII nowe translated out of Latyne into Englyshe ; to the inte[n]t, that thing is well said to a fewe, may be vnderstande of many, and do good to al the[m] that desyre to be better. Latimer, Hugh, 1485?-1555.
[71] p.
By Thomas Berthelet ..., Imprinted at London : 1537, the 23 of Nouember.
Imprint taken from colophon. "Cum priuilegio."--Colophon. Signatures: A-D⁸ E⁴. Title in ornamental border. Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
Thomas Berthelet
